meanings.definition: To sing or play music to someone as a token of affection or admiration.
meanings.sent1: Every night, the young man stood under her window, serenading her with his guitar.
meanings.sent2: The musician was serenading the audience with his beautiful voice.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat outside the door, serenading its owner with meows for attention.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered through the trees, serenading the forest with its gentle melody.
meanings.sent5: The waves serenading the shore created a peaceful atmosphere by the beach.

meanings.definition: The act of performing music for someone as a gesture of love or admiration.
meanings.sent1: The serenading of the violinist touched the hearts of all who listened.
meanings.sent2: At the park, a group of friends surprised their friend with a serenading session.
meanings.sent3: The serenading of the birds in the morning brought joy to the sleepy town.
meanings.sent4: The serenading of the piano keys filled the room with warmth and emotion.
meanings.sent5: The serenading of the choir echoed through the halls, enchanting the audience.
